revised_title: The Structure and Function of the Electric Organ in Raia circularis
tldr: This study examines the structure of the electric organ in the skate species Raia circularis. The organ consists of large, cup-shaped bodies with three distinct layers: the lining, a thick median striated layer, and an outer cortical layer. The organ's structure and function provide insights into the biology and electrophysiology of fish nervous systems.
